intro: Anaphrenium concolor, commonly known as the smoothleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and trumpet-shaped, violet-blue flowers that open in the morning. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Anaphrenium concolor is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered a weed due to its invasive tendencies.
